creator: arthur_box@yahoo.com
text:
I use php-4.3.10 with httpd-2.0.53 on Fedora Core 1
Also I use mod_rewrite and my php files are encoded with Zend Safeguard.
Few days ago I've noticed that my web-site sometimes (not always) fails to show 
the same page. It happens occassionally and log file contains line like
"[Mon Feb 28 16:04:43 2005] [notice] child pid 3686 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)". Tried almost everything from disabling separate modules to 
recompiling kernel. Please help!

creator: arthur_box@yahoo.com
text:
here is my dump:
gdb /usr/sbin/httpd

(gdb) run -X
Starting program: /usr/sbin/httpd -X
casp2ap: Sun ONE ASP web server module started, version 4.0.0.34

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x007606be in ?? ()
(gdb) bt

(gdb)

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Unfortunately with a stack trace like that it could be anything.  Try disabling
the Zend stuff and whatever other proprietary code you have loaded; if you can
get a useful backtrace please file here or at bugs.php.net as appropriate. 
Otherwise contact Zend for support.

creator: arthur_box@yahoo.com
text:
I've found that the source of crash was PHP Tidy module.
Disabling resolves the problem.
